page.title: 16COMMUNITY SHOP
page.content: In 1984 the village Co-op was closed, despite protests from the inhabitants.The Tenants and residents then formed a Village Committee and commenced the long and frustating negotiations to open a Village Community Shop.The Greater London Enterprise Board promised the money for this, if the residents could raise Â£5000. Currently they have raised Â£5900. This venture has been described in the "Independant Grocer" as a landmark, as it is proposed to use the profits for the benefit of the village.It is also hoped that the other shops will benefit as their trade has been adversely affected by the fact that a focal point in the village has gone. The concern is that the High Street should not become an area that fails to serve its own community.
